newsitem.title: HONG KONG: KPI plans 1-for-5 rights issue.
newsitem.headline: KPI plans 1-for-5 rights issue.

text.p: Chemical fertiliser and agricultural products trader KPI Company Ltd said on Tuesday it plans a one-for-five rights issue to raise about HK$46.5 million after expenses.
The company will issue between 58.8 million and 75.88 million rights shares at HK$0.82 each, representing a 24 percent discount to the Monday close of HK$1.08, it said in a statement.
The issue size would depend on the exercise of outstanding warrants and share options amounting to 70.70 million new shares on full conversion, it said.
KPI shares eased HK$0.08 to HK$1.00 on Tuesday morning.

The company said managing director Cheung Siu Lam and Arbalice Holdings Ltd, who control a total of 113.48 million shares or 38.6 percent of the company's issued share capital, agreed to accept 22.70 million rights shares allocated to them.
The net proceeds of the issue would be used for capital investment, repayment of bank borrowings and as additional working capital, it said.
